channel.title: Compiler issue
channel.description:
Hello, mopar community.
Brand new to working with rsps's, but it is something of which has often intrigued me. I downloaded a 317 "blanked" Rs2007 source/client.
I am trying to get the compiler to function accordingly. But here is my problem..
When ever I attempt to compile, I recieve this error.
Javac: File not found: *.java Usage: java <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options
I did some googling and it appeared that my enviroment variables were possibly the problem.
So, I jump into the enviroment variables through my computer and such (I have no doubt that you lot are aware of what I am talking about). I editted my "Path" setting with the the correct path.
Which would be. C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_05\bin
But I seem to be recieving the same problem that I originally encountered.
Any suggestions?

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @Foundationrepair Foundationrepair
item.description:
@Foundationrepair wrote:

That’s not a problem at all. Thanks, I’ll pm you if I need advice.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Try a blank pi. Getting one of those ones packed with content totally contradicts this community’s moral of learning and teaching others. I’d be more than happy to help you with anything if you want to lean. No, I will not do it for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @Foundationrepair Foundationrepair
item.description:
@Foundationrepair wrote:

I think it might be a wise move for me to use another source, would you recommend any for a beginner to start with?

Read full topic

try just Files/*.java i guess

Javac: file not found: Files*.java
Usage: java
use -help for a list of possible options

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Try @echo off @title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_06\bin\javac.exe" Files Files/*.java Files/sign/*.java pause exit

Read full topic

This is inside the “Files” folder.

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @Foundationrepair Foundationrepair
item.description:
@Foundationrepair wrote:

Appears to be a no go, I recieved the following…

Javac: file not found: src*.java
Usage: java
use -help for a list of possible options

I am beginning to question this source that I have in my possession.
If it appears that this may be the case, could you point out a good base for a beginner to try out?

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW

@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @Foundationrepair Foundationrepair
item.description:
@Foundationrepair wrote:

I have an src folder in my source folder, which contains a file called “classpath”. I think that was it’s original name. When checking the name seemed to dissapear, so I renamed it to that. I assume that may cause future problems if not named as it was.

The folder also has a project file and possesses a server folder which has all sorts in there, I am assuming what you’re calling “classes”.

If not, then what exactly are classes, if one could elaborate?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Do you have folders where you’re classes are located? Perhaps named Java or src?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @Foundationrepair Foundationrepair
item.description:
@Foundationrepair wrote:

Ok well, here is the current information in my compiler.

@echo off
@title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_06\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause
exit

And I’ll throw up in the formation in the compiler of the client I am trying to use.

@echo off
TITLE Compiling
cd Files
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_06\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Copy your compiler into here and I’ll show you what I’m talking about.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @Foundationrepair Foundationrepair
item.description:
@Foundationrepair wrote:

Well, I am new, which I did state at the beginning of this thread. Not sure if I would go as far as dumb.

I tried your suggestion Null, no good.

Riip.

I am trying to get a grasp of which you believe is required for me to do. I assume the that the package(s) of which I am meant to be looking for, may not be the path of which I am placing in the compiler. Which I think it is the “.*java” file. Or is it?

You seem to have more of an understanding what I packages I am meant to be looking for.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Dumb. :fp: to all of you.

The problem is the compiler is searching for a package that isn’t there. Right click the compiler, click edit and go through the packages your telling the compiler to turn into raw data. Then either fix the name of the folder or delete that route for the compiler.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

@echo off color 0D title Compiler echo Compiling Your Work... "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_06\bin\javac.exe" *.java echo Finished Compiling! pause

Try using that and see what you get.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @Foundationrepair Foundationrepair
item.description:
@Foundationrepair wrote:

@echo off
@title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_06\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause
exit

I was suspecting that it might just be the source, considering I was able to make a different source function. But it is more likely that I have something constructed wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @RsMakerWoad RsMakerWoad
item.description:
@RsMakerWoad wrote:

[quote=“segaxvi, post:2, topic:458721”][quote author=Foundationrepair link=topic=561630.msg4096597#msg4096597 date=1346927016]
Hello, mopar community.

Brand new to working with rsps’s, but it is something of which has often intrigued me.
I downloaded a 317 “blanked” Rs2007 source/client.

I am trying to get the compiler to function accordingly. But here is my problem…

When ever I attempt to compile, I recieve this error.

Javac: File not found: *.java
Usage: java
use -help for a list of possible options

I did some googling and it appeared that my enviroment variables were possibly the problem.

So, I jump into the enviroment variables through my computer and such (I have no doubt that you lot are aware of what I am talking about). I editted my “Path” setting with the the correct path.

Which would be.
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_05\bin

But I seem to be recieving the same problem that I originally encountered.

Any suggestions?
[/quote]

Download and install jdk1.6.0_25 and then try.[/quote]
Dont listen to that twit,he posts on everyone

  1. download jdk 1.7.0.06
  2. Edit compiler and it should say either 1.7.0.05 change it to 1.7.0.06
    3.save,completed;)

Read full topic
